awd_titl_txt: Nuclei and Dust of Comets in the Thermal IR
awd_abstract_narration: 95-30749  Fomenkova    Dr. Fomenkova and her Co-Principal Investigator, Dr. Barbara  Jones, will carry  out a three-year project of infrared (IR) imaging and  spectroscopic  observations of comets during perihelion passage.  The  objective is to  determine (1) the physical characteristics of cometary  nuclei -- size,  rotation, surface properties, composition, and mechanisms of  coma formation,  (2) physical and chemical alterations of dust grains in the  inner coma, and  (3) the extent of heterogeneity of individual comet nuclei  and from one comet  nucleus to another.    One comet the investigators intend to study in detail is  comet O1 Hale-Bopp,  which is currently approaching the inner solar system and  will reach  perihelion in April 1997.    The observations will be carried out with the investigators'  imaging camera  mounted on the 1.5 meter telescope at the Mt. Lemmon  Observatory and the new  Long Wavelength Spectrometer of the Keck telescope.  The Mt.  Lemmon  Observatory is jointly operated by the investigators' home  institution (the  University of California in San Diego) and the University of  Minnesota.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
